sentences.en: Although his female colleagues insisted the grayaccentuated his bookish appeal, Langdon knew better.
sentences.cn: 虽然他的女同事们一直说花白的头发使他显得更儒雅, 可兰登不那么想.

sentences.en: At this meeting Olga's bookish and countrified sister, Tatiana ( Tanya ) , falls in love with Onegin.
sentences.cn: 聚会中,奥佳那位书生气十足且满身土气的姐姐塔替雅娜爱上了奥涅金.

sentences.en: Bookish in in the show, in the weak and strong in the shows.
sentences.cn: 在书生气中尽显痴狂, 在软弱中透着坚强.

sentences.en: Don't be so bookish and unrealistic.
He also criticized the concepts, methods, and goals of the bookish scholars.
sentences.cn: 他也批判了书呆子的概念 、 方法和目标.

sentences.en: He was bookish, a swot and very close to his mother.
sentences.cn: 他有点书呆子气, 勤奋好学,和他母亲非常亲近.

sentences.en: He was filled with bookish notions.
He was reticent, patrician, bookish, urbane.
sentences.cn: 他沉默含蓄, 雍容华贵, 书生气十足,而又温文有礼.

sentences.en: He writes in a bookish style.
sentences.cn: 他写信的风格是文诌诌的.

sentences.en: Like begets like , and they are both rather silent bookish people.
sentences.cn: 俩人都是寡言的书呆子.

sentences.en: Never be so bookish and naive as to treat complex class struggle as a simple matter.
sentences.cn: 切不可书生气十足,把复杂的阶级斗争看得太简单了.

sentences.en: She was always a bookish child.
sentences.cn: 她一直是个爱读书的孩子.

sentences.en: The bookish historian now accepts it, reluctantly and ungraciously enough.
sentences.cn: 钻书本的历史学者现在相当勉强和冷淡地承认了它.

sentences.en: The poor girl liked to be thought clever, but she hated to be thought bookish.
sentences.cn: 可怜的姑娘喜欢人家说她聪明, 可是反对把她当作书呆子.

sentences.en: This vision of intelligence asserts formal education and bookish excellence as the true measures of self - fulfillment.
sentences.cn: 这种智力观断定正规教育和优秀的书本知识是衡量 自我 实现的真正标准.

words.tran_cn: 书籍；卷；帐簿；名册；工作簿
书本上的；好读书的；书呆子气的

trans.tran_cn: 书本上的，好学的，书呆子
trans.tran_en: someone who is bookish is more interested in reading and studying than in sports or other activities
